trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization"></xref> namespace contains classes that are used to serialize objects into XML format documents or streams.
The central class in the namespace is the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer> class.
To use this class, use the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer.%23ctor%2A> constructor to create an instance of the class using the type of the object to serialize.
Once an <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer> is created, create an instance of the object to serialize.
You must also create an object to write the file to a document or stream, such as a <xref:System.IO.Stream>, <xref:System.IO.TextWriter>, or <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter>.
You can then call the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer.Serialize%2A> method to convert the object into an XML document.
To deserialize an object from an XML document, create a suitable object to read the document or stream (again, a <xref:System.IO.Stream>, <xref:System.IO.TextWriter>, or <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter>).
Invoke the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer.Deserialize%2A> method while casting the resulting object to the type of the original object (that was serialized).
To further control the serialization, the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization> namespace contains several <xref:System.Attribute> classes that can be applied to members of a class.
For example, if a class contains a member that will be serialized as an XML element, you can apply the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlElementAttribute> attribute to the member.
When applying the attribute, you can specify details such as the actual XML element name using the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlElementAttribute.ElementName%2A> property.
For a complete list of all the attributes, see the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer> class overview.
